Show HN: Indicator Dash – Rank and compare to mitigate crypto market uncertainty
text:
For the last two years, I have been hard at work to launch Indicator Dash, along with its parent company, Hex Datum OÜ (https://hexdatum.com/). Before that, I was an academic for over 10 years, a career that culminated with my PhD thesis, entitled "Graph-Based Entity-Oriented Search", successfully defended in 2021. More about me here: https://josedevezas.com/

Now, a bit about Indicator Dash.

Indicator Dash is a crypto analytics product where we provide normalized signals, ready to be combined by the user in a personalized manner to support learning or decision-making through rankings.

I believe this approach to be a middle ground between raw indicators and algorithmic trading approaches. Here, users only need to understand what the indicator represents, but the interpretation process is already done, in the backstage, by Indicator Dash, resulting in specific signals extracted from multiple indicator statistics or configurations. This enables regular users to create custom pair ranking solutions, at the distance of a click, without the need to learn about algorithmic trading and implement their own script. Of course, this comes at a cost: only indicator interpretations implemented by us are supported, but we plan to keep expanding our indicator signals for a long time!

We also collect, categorize, classify, and index crypto news articles, extracting and organizing entities into a knowledge graph. All this content is available through our search engines, or through beautiful ego network visualizations, that let you explore crypto contexts, to learn about new actors in the field and discover new coins.

If you'd like to test Indicator Dash, you can sign up for a free account, or use the coupon, specifically created for Hacker News, to get a 50% discount on basic or premium accounts until October 2022. The coupon can only be redeemed 10 times, so get it while it's fresh! You can also watch our demo video here, if you'd prefer: https://youtu.be/Pa5WujQ8bXA

Let me know what you like, dislike, or would like to see in Indicator Dash! Your feedback is invaluable. If you'd like to structure feedback, you can also leave an entry here: https://feedback.indicatordash.app/ And thank you for taking the time to learn about our first Hex Datum product!

Show HN: Off-site, encrypted backups for $1/TB/month at 99.999999999% durability
text:
Hi,

most people (hopefully) have local backups. However, when that backup fails, it is good to have a backup stored somewhere off-site. In the old days you would ship physical drives/tapes, which is cumbersome, costly, and slow. With fast upload speeds, it is now possible to upload your data to the cloud. I have found S3 Glacier Deep Archive to be a great solution for this:

- It is very cheap ($1/TB/month for US region) - Very reliable (99.999999999% data durability, data spread over 3 Availability Zones)

However, usability out of the box is not that great, I'm not aware of any automated backup solution for Deep Archive. This free project provides that.

Currently, ZFS is required, but that might change. Please try it out and provide feedback!
